prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] 2. Draw the first face (face_1) of the prism: * Draw a loop (loop_1) consisting of 8 line segments: 1. Line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.0] 2. Line_2: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.125] 3. Line_3: [0.25, 0.125] to [0.5, 0.125] 4. Line_4: [0.5, 0.125] to [0.5, 0.0] 5. Line_5: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] 6. Line_6: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.625] 7. Line_7: [0.75, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.625] 8. Line_8: [0.0, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Draw the second face (face_2) of the prism by repeating the loop_1 from face_1. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.5 units. Part 2: Create a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.125, 0.625] 2. Draw the face (face_1) of the prism with the triangular cutout: * Draw a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 line segments: 1. Line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.25] 3. Line_3: [0.75, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.25] 4. Line_4: [0.0, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the opposite normal direction by a distance of 0.125 units.</description>
